CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW provides that the ORG shall rule on a constitutional appeal lodged in respect of an alleged violation of a human right or freedom guaranteed by LAW , after all other effective legal remedies have been exhausted .
CARDINAL . This LAW entered into force on DATE .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that a constitutional appeal can be filed against an individual decision of a state body , an administrative body , local self - government body or a legal person exercising public authority , for violations of human rights and freedoms guaranteed by the LAW , after all other effective domestic remedies have been exhausted . Sections DATE provide additional details as regards the processing of constitutional appeals .
CARDINAL . This Act entered into force in DATE .

CARDINAL . This Act provides , under certain circumstances , for the possibility to have lengthy proceedings expedited by means of request for review ( kontrolni zahtjev ) , as well as an opportunity for the claimants to be awarded compensation therefor by means of an action for fair redress ( tužba za pravično zadovoljenje ) .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL , in particular , provides that this Act shall be applied retroactively to all proceedings from DATE , but that the duration of proceedings before that date shall also be taken into account .
CARDINAL . This Act entered into force on DATE , but contained no reference to applications involving procedural delay already lodged with the ORG .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that in simple matters an administrative body is obliged to issue a decision within DATE of a party ’s lodging a request . In all other cases , the administrative body is obliged to issue a decision within DATE of the lodging of the request .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL enables a party whose request has not been decided within the periods established in the previous paragraph to lodge an appeal to the appellate body as if his request had been refused . If the appeal is not allowed , the applicant can directly initiate an administrative dispute before the court with jurisdiction .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that a party can institute administrative proceedings before ORG ( administrative dispute ) if the appellate body does not issue a decision within DATE nor within DATE ; or if the first - instance body does not issue a decision and there is no right to an appeal .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that ORG itself can rule on the merits if a decision has already been quashed in the same dispute and the relevant body has not acted fully in accordance with ORG judgment or if it has not issued a new decision within DATE . ORG can also rule on the merits if the appellate body , or the first - instance body where there is no right to an appeal , has not ruled within the envisaged time - limit .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of this Act provided that if during the expropriation of a part of one ’s real estate it is established that the owner can no longer normally use the remaining property , has no economic interest in using it or if his very means of support is thereby jeopardised , the remaining property shall also be expropriated if he requests it .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that anybody can request an administrative inspection .

CARDINAL . Sections CARDINAL - CARDINAL specify the rights and duties of inspectors , which , inter alia , include their right to identify irregularities and order that adequate measures be undertaken , as well as adequate fines imposed .
